[Moderator: the message has been edited to clean up EOLs]

> > Using RedHat 8.0, JUnit 3.8.1, and JDK 1.4.1_01 I tried to
> > run the textui and found that it could not run anything.
> 
> OK.  I'm using RedHat 9.0, JUnit 3.8.1 and JDK 1.4.1_01.
> 
> Everything works fine.  junit.samples.AllTests as well as
> 
> junit.tests.AllTests... in textui, swingui, and Eclipse plugin.
> 
> I do notice that in your cmd line examples you don't specify a
> classpath.  I built sat in the junit bin directory (i.e. where the
> class file tree is rooted and used cmd lines such as:
> 
>  java -classpath . junit.textui.TestRunner junit.tests.AllTests
>
> I never used RedHat 8.0, I leapfrogged from 7.2 to 9.0
> 
> Dave

Thanks for the response.  I am downloading Redhat 9 ISOs and 
I hope that they will solve the problem.  There are also additional 
noteworthy points:

1) I really think classpath settings don't help.  My classpath 
already includes the directory with the junit.jar file, and name 
the junit.jar file.

Just to test this, I took the trouble of using various classpath 
extensions,  starting with -classpath . and going from there, 
in the root directory and below it also.  I found that most 
additional classpaths produced additional "Class not found" errors.

There was one exception.  The swingui would run successfully
if I specified -classpath 

    $CLASSPATH:./junit.jar

but that was just repeating a segment of the normal classpath.

2) Note that the textui will run in the jdb.  under which 
circumstance it shows a great many dots and a single F for the
AllTests test (it does this both for the samples.AllTests and
the tests.AllTests).  It also runs the money.MoneyTest with
22 dots and no F's, comparable to the swingui output.

3) I had neglected to mention that additional lines of debug
output cited by the swingui.  They mention sun.reflect code,
specifically:

    sun.reflect.nativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke()
and
    sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodccessorImpl.invoke()

4) I don't know how justified I am in considering this to be a
serious bug.  I am inclined to raise it on the developers' 
mail list, if the present forum considers it to be a genuine
bug rather than a minor misconfiguration issue.
